intro: Psammisia longirachis, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandplant, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dune environments. Due to its resilience, it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes and preventing erosion.
